page.title: 02COASTAL LANDSCAPE OF HORNSEA
page.content: Hornsea is 17 miles north of Hull and is an east coast{resort.}The original cliffs were several miles inland but the{glacier}brought clay and smothered the cliffs in{clay.}We wouldn't be here now if it hadn't been for the glacier and we wouldn't have a town called Hornsea. Hornsea is on the {Holderness Plain. } In Hornsea we have{soft cliffs}so the sea is eating or wearing away our cliffs, so we have to deal with {erosion.}Since Roman times, three villages and one fresh-water mere have been washed away by the sea. The waves approach the coast diagonally, and push or carry stones and other materials{southwards}along the beach. This is called{longshore {drift}and many{groynes}have been built to protect our beach. Dennis Fewster
